bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to J.W. Schereschewsky, May 7, 1919

div1.p: Carter writes that he may be well enough to travel in order to meet with Fricks and LePrince.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to J.W. Schereschewsky, May 7, 1919
div1.opener:
May 7, 1919
Dr. J. W. Schereschewsky,
U.S. Public Health Service,
Washington, D.C.
Dear Doctor Schereschewsky:
div1.p:
Dr. Acker thinks I will be able to travel
Monday afternoon, in which case I will be in Washington
Thursday morning and am, of course, ready to meet Fricks
and LePrince for conference. If by any chance I may not
be able to keep this appointment I will wire you as soon
as I know it.

I have not been allowed to stand on my
feet so far but am sitting up and I am sure I could walk
if allowed.
